body_html:
Just had a look at InvertPermutation and noticed that a GPU version based on HostMemory has been added by now.
I like the idea of re-using ScatterFunctor for this, but it wouldn't check whether there are duplicate permutation indices in the input (which the current version of the code does).
body_text:
Just had a look at InvertPermutation and noticed that a GPU version based on HostMemory has been added by now.
I like the idea of re-using ScatterFunctor for this, but it wouldn't check whether there are duplicate permutation indices in the input (which the current version of the code does).
body:
Just had a look at `InvertPermutation` and noticed that a GPU version based on `HostMemory` has been added by now.
I like the idea of re-using `ScatterFunctor` for this, but it wouldn't check whether there are duplicate permutation indices in the input (which the current version of the code does).
